The number of deaths reported in Norway: 19 vaccine increased from 23 to 33, out of about 48,000 vaccinated.
Norwegian health authorities stated that: relatively mild side effects from the vaccine, such as fever and nausea, could have contributed to the deaths of the most frail patients.
The Norwegian Medicines Agency emphasize: 19 vaccines caused the deaths, and that Norway's reporting culture for vaccine adverse reactions may lead to a low threshold for reporting even when causal relationships are unclear.
The head of the Norwegian Institute of P: suggesting that the reported deaths may not represent excess mortality or have a causal connection to the vaccine.
